meanings.definition: The quality or state of being punitive.
meanings.sent1: Her punitiveness towards rule-breakers was evident in her strict enforcement of consequences.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's punitiveness was seen in the detention given to students who were late.
meanings.sent3: The punitiveness of the principal's glare made the students giggle nervously.
meanings.sent4: The punitiveness of the referee's calls made the game feel like a battle.
meanings.sent5: The punitiveness of the storm left a trail of destruction in its wake.

meanings.definition: The tendency to punish or inflict penalties.
meanings.sent1: The coach's punitiveness motivated the team to work harder during practice.
meanings.sent2: The punitiveness of the law was evident in the hefty fines imposed on offenders.
meanings.sent3: The punitiveness of the traffic lights seemed to be testing the driver's patience.
meanings.sent4: The punitiveness of the judge's sentence shocked the courtroom.
meanings.sent5: The punitiveness of the sun's rays made everyone seek shade during the hot day.
